data.title: GEOPOLITICS | U.S., Russia, and Ukraine Prepare for Upcoming Talks
data.description:
The United States has engaged in meetings with representatives from Russia and Ukraine to prepare for a trilateral discussion scheduled for early next month. According to RTHK, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky stated that the next round of talks between the U.S., Russia, and Ukraine might take place in Abu Dhabi, the capital of the United Arab Emirates, in early March. All parties have reportedly made thorough preparations for the negotiations. Zelensky emphasized the need to identify outcomes that would ensure genuine security guarantees and mentioned the organization of a leadership-level meeting.

The U.S. news website Axios reported that U.S. President Donald Trump and Zelensky had a 30-minute phone conversation on Wednesday. During the call, Zelensky expressed his hope for the Russia-Ukraine conflict to end within the year, while Trump indicated his desire for the war to conclude within a month.

data.title: China Eases Yuan's Rise by Adjusting Derivatives Market
data.description: China has intensified its measures to moderate the yuan's appreciation by eliminating the extra fee for wagering against the currency in the derivatives market. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting this strategic move as part of China's broader efforts to manage its currency's value amid global economic fluctuations. This adjustment aims to provide more flexibility in the foreign exchange market, reflecting China's ongoing commitment to stabilizing its financial environment. The decision comes as the yuan has experienced significant upward pressure, prompting authorities to intervene and ensure balanced market conditions.

data.title: Alberta's Budget Deficit Expected to Double Amid Population Growth and Lower Oil Prices
data.description: Alberta, Canada's leading oil-producing province, anticipates its budget deficit will more than double in the upcoming fiscal year. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting that this financial strain is attributed to declining crude oil prices coupled with a significant increase in population. The province's public finances are under pressure as these factors converge, challenging Alberta's economic stability. The projected deficit underscores the impact of fluctuating oil markets on regions heavily reliant on energy revenues. Alberta's government is now tasked with addressing these fiscal challenges while managing the demands of a growing population.

data.title: Generate Biomedicines Secures $400 Million in IPO
data.description: Generate Biomedicines has successfully raised $400 million through its initial public offering, with shares priced at the midpoint of the marketed range. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting the company's strategic move in the biotechnology sector. The funds raised are expected to support the company's ongoing research and development efforts, as well as its expansion plans. Generate Biomedicines aims to leverage this capital to advance its innovative approaches in the field of biomedicine.

data.title: Analyst Highlights Challenges in Tracking Crypto Transactions
data.description: Analyst @ai_9684xtpa posted on X that tracking cryptocurrency transactions can be challenging due to frequent wallet changes by users. This practice makes it difficult to trace activities on the blockchain, although backend systems can monitor transactions through invitation relationships. The analyst emphasized the significance of insider information in understanding these complex dynamics.

data.title: Asian Currencies Decline as Risk-Off Sentiment Prevails
data.description:
Asian currencies experienced a decline as investors adopted a risk-off sentiment. Wall Street Journal (Markets) posted on X, highlighting the trend across the region's currency markets. The shift in investor sentiment comes amid concerns over global economic uncertainties and geopolitical tensions, prompting a move away from riskier assets.

The weakening of Asian currencies reflects broader market apprehensions, with investors seeking safer havens such as the U.S. dollar. This trend is influenced by various factors, including fluctuating commodity prices and potential changes in monetary policies by major central banks.

Market analysts suggest that the current sentiment may persist as long as uncertainties remain in the global economic landscape. The focus is on upcoming economic indicators and policy decisions that could further impact currency valuations.

Overall, the decline in Asian currencies underscores the cautious approach adopted by investors in response to prevailing market conditions.

data.title: Anthropic CEO Rejects Pentagon's AI Demand, Risking Contract Fallout
data.description: Anthropic's CEO has declined the Pentagon's request for unrestricted military use of its AI technology, potentially jeopardizing existing contracts and risking a supply chain risk designation. According to NS3.AI, the disagreement arises from Anthropic's safeguards against the use of its AI for autonomous weapons targeting and mass surveillance. This situation could set a precedent affecting how governments might pressure cryptocurrency firms to compromise on privacy and security features.

data.title: WSJ: TFH partners with Gap, Visa, and Tinder to promote World ID human verification product
data.description: Tools for Humanity (TFH), the development team behind Worldcoin, is collaborating with Gap, Visa, and Tinder to promote the application of its "World ID" biometric authentication product. Reports indicate that some Gap stores in San Francisco have already deployed "Orb" devices to collect facial and iris information from users to generate World IDs. Simultaneously, TFH plans to launch a Visa-linked payment card, allowing World ID holders to use digital assets for purchases. Dating app Tinder is also testing the identity system in Japan to verify users' identities and age information. TFH states that the Orb device converts facial and iris images into anonymous digital identifiers and stores them on the user's device; the company itself does not retain the original biometric data. Its business model aims to generate revenue by charging applications for verification services. (Wall Street Journal)

data.title: GEOPOLITICS | FAA Closes Texas Airspace Amid Reports of Anti-Drone Laser Weapon Use
data.description: The U.S. Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) has closed the airspace over Fort Hancock, Texas, following reports of anti-drone laser weapon usage in the area. According to Jin10, this decision comes amid growing concerns over the deployment of advanced military technology in domestic airspace. The closure aims to ensure the safety of both civilian and military aircraft operating in the region. The FAA has not provided a timeline for when the airspace might reopen, as investigations into the reports are ongoing. This development highlights the increasing focus on counter-drone measures and their implications for airspace management.

data.title: Bitcoin(BTC) Drops Below 67,000 USDT with a 2.13% Decrease in 24 Hours
data.description: On Feb 27, 2026, 01:07 AM(UTC). According to Binance Market Data, Bitcoin has dropped below 67,000 USDT and is now trading at 66,994.453125 USDT, with a narrowed 2.13% decrease in 24 hours.

data.title: U.S. Government Advises Against Contempt Ruling for Argentina in YPF Case
data.description: The U.S. government has requested that a federal judge refrain from holding Argentina in contempt over accusations of not providing officials’ texts and emails. Bloomberg posted on X that this request is related to a case involving former shareholders of YPF, who are attempting to enforce an $18 billion judgment against Argentina. The legal dispute centers on Argentina's nationalization of YPF, an oil company, which has led to significant financial claims by the former shareholders. The U.S. government's involvement highlights the international implications of the case, as it seeks to balance diplomatic relations with legal obligations. The outcome of this request could impact the enforcement of the judgment and the broader legal proceedings.

data.title: Morgan Stanley plans to expand its Bitcoin custody and trading services, and explore yield and lending businesses.
data.description: Morgan Stanley's newly appointed head of digital asset strategy, Amy Oldenburg, stated that the company plans to offer Bitcoin custody and trading services to its clients. Morgan Stanley currently manages nearly $9 trillion in client assets. At the Enterprise Bitcoin Conference in Las Vegas, Oldenburg also mentioned that Bitcoin-related yield and lending services are under discussion and exploration, stating that these business directions are part of the company's digital asset strategic roadmap, although it is still in its early stages. (Decrypt)

The crypto sector was mixed, with DFDV falling over 12.11%, UPXI falling over 7.92%, BTCS falling over 6.78%, ALTS falling over 5.96%, and CRCL falling over 4.9%. msx.com is a decentralized RWA trading platform that has listed hundreds of RWA tokens, covering US stock and ETF tokens such as AAPL, AMZN, GOOGL, META, MSFT, NFLX, and NVDA.

data.title: POAP founder deposits $4.11 million worth of ETH into Binance
data.description: According to Onchain Lens, POAP founder Patricio Worthalter (@worthalter) deposited 2,000 ETH worth $4.11 million into Binance 9 hours ago.

data.title: Anthropic Won’t Lift AI Safeguards Amid Ongoing Pentagon Dispute: CEO
data.description:
Anthropic CEO’s said the company will not comply with Defense Department demands as the Pentagon weighs whether to label the company a “supply chain risk. ”
source: https://decrypt.co/359358/anthropic-wont-lift-ai-safeguards-pentagon-dispute

data.title: Expert Insights: Early Bitcoin Holders Drive Recent Pullback
data.description: Ari Paul from BlockTower Capital has highlighted the role of market makers in influencing intraday volatility, which often results in short-lived price movements. According to NS3.AI, the recent decline in Bitcoin's value is primarily attributed to substantial selling by early Bitcoin holders. This selling pressure has not been met with sufficient buying interest, leading to the pullback. Paul advises investors to enhance their analytical approaches instead of attributing price changes to manipulation, emphasizing that upward price movements are typically more common in asset markets.

data.title: US lawmakers have introduced the "Blockchain Innovation Promotion Act of 2026," which aims to clarify the scope of Section 1960.
data.description: According to the DeFi Education Fund, U.S. Representatives Scott Fitzgerald, Ben Cline, and Zoe Lofgren have jointly introduced the "Blockchain Innovation Promotion Act of 2026," which aims to clarify the scope of application of Title 18, Section 1960 of the United States Code regarding "permissionless money transfer businesses." The bill seeks to clarify that Section 1960 only applies to entities that control customer assets and transfer funds on behalf of customers, and should not extend to blockchain software developers who do not control user funds. The proposal states that this move aligns with the original intent of Congress and the long-standing regulatory interpretations of the U.S. Treasury Department's Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (FinCEN), aiming to reduce the risk of developers facing undue criminal charges.

data.title: Sources familiar with the matter: PayPal has not entered into negotiations with Stripe regarding a sale.
data.description: According to Semafor, citing sources familiar with the matter, PayPal is not currently in talks with Stripe or any other company regarding a sale. The report states that PayPal has been working with investment banks for months to prepare for potential activist shareholder actions or unpopular takeover offers. These preparations began after a significant drop in the company's stock price, with management concerned that a lower valuation could put the company under external pressure. Sources also indicated that this collaboration began during the tenure of former CEO Alex Chriss.

data.title: An OTC whale holding over $572 million in assets sent 23,500 ETH to FalconX.
data.description: According to Onchain Lens monitoring, OTC trading whale "0xfb7" sent 23,500 ETH ($47.47 million) to FalconX for sale and to repay loans. Currently, this whale holds: - 4,000 cbBTC ($269 million) - 120,380 stETH ($243.27 million) - 29,727 WETH ($60.16 million) and borrowed $97.26 million USDT from Aave.
